sec.title: What is already known about this topic?
sec.p: Although influenza activity is typically low in the United States during the summer months, CDC collects, compiles, and analyzes data to monitor influenza activity throughout the year.

sec.title: What is added by this report?
sec.p: In the United States, influenza activity remained low with cocirculation of influenza A and influenza B viruses. Influenza viruses circulated widely in the Southern Hemisphere, with A(H3) viruses predominating in most regions, although influenza A(H1N1)pdm09 and influenza B/Victoria viruses predominated in several countries.

sec.title: What are the implications for public health practice?
sec.p: Receiving a seasonal influenza vaccine each year remains the best way to protect against seasonal influenza and its potentially severe consequences.
